content_suggestions.section: Experience – Ascentio Technologies (Product Owner, Systems Engineer) – July 2022 – July 2025
content_suggestions.issue: Lacks explicit alignment to CV production deployment in manufacturing/quality contexts and misses domain-agnostic manufacturing cues present in the job description.
content_suggestions.before: - Managed teams of up to 10 people as Product Owner and Systems Engineer, leading the Technological Infrastructure and Science Data Processing subsystems of the SABIA-Mar satellite mission.  - Launched the company’s artificial-intelligence division, transferring expertise to the team and enabling the acquisition of new clients in computer vision and Industry 4.0.  - Led end-to-end a computer-vision production-control system for an industrial plant, covering design, production rollout and ongoing maintenance. The solution blends multi-object detection and tracking, edge computing, IoT protocols and real-time dashboards, enabling performance and efficiency monitoring.  - Implemented over 20 improvements to the L0 processor of the SABIA-Mar satellite mission in Python, fulfilling client-required functionalities within a 3-month timeframe.
content_suggestions.after: - Led teams of up to 10 as Product Owner and Systems Engineer, directing the Technological Infrastructure and Science Data Processing subsystems of the SABIA-Mar satellite mission.  - Launched the company’s artificial-intelligence division, transferring expertise to the team and enabling the acquisition of new clients in computer vision and Industry 4.0.  - Led end-to-end a computer-vision production-control system for an industrial plant, covering design, production rollout and ongoing maintenance, including multi-object detection/tracking, edge computing, IoT protocols and real-time dashboards.  - Implemented over 20 improvements to the L0 processor of the SABIA-Mar satellite mission in Python, fulfilling client-required functionalities within a three-month timeframe.

content_suggestions.issue: Internship entry lacks a direct tie to industrial CV applications; could be reframed to emphasize transferable CV/data science skills.
content_suggestions.before: - Developed a platform for automatic crop detection in Python, achieving 80% accuracy using supervised classification algorithms applied to time series of multi-spectral satellite images.
content_suggestions.after: - Developed a platform for automatic crop detection in Python, achieving 80% accuracy using supervised classification algorithms applied to time series of multi-spectral satellite images.

content_suggestions.issue: Relevance to CV/AI role is limited; could be condensed or rephrased to preserve space for more impactful CV-related content.
content_suggestions.before: - Contributed to the project "Improving university campus accessibility – Hearing loops", implementing systems to enhance hearing for people with impairments.
content_suggestions.after: - Contributed to the project "Improving university campus accessibility – Hearing loops", implementing systems to enhance hearing for people with impairments.

content_suggestions.issue: Current list is broad but could be reorganized to foreground Computer Vision, ML/DL workflows, and production deployment; ensure alignment with job requirements.
content_suggestions.before: - Python (OOP, NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, pytest, FastAPI, CI/CD).  - R (basic analytics) and MATLAB programming.  - Databases: SQL .  - Machine Learning & AI : supervised/unsupervised models, reinforcement learning; time-series forecasting; deep learning with PyTorch and Keras/TensorFlow; LLMs; generative AI & prompt engineering.  - Computer Vision : object detection and segmentation, OpenCV, digital image processing, remote sensing imagery, GIS.  - Data Engineering : ETL pipelines and Apache Airflow orchestration.  - Data Visualisation & Dashboards : Tableau, PowerBI, Grafana.  - Web/UI Prototyping : Gradio, Streamlit.  - DevOps & Cloud : Git, GitHub & GitHub Actions, Docker, Docker Swarm, Kubernetes, high-concurrency architecture, AWS, GCP.  - IoT & Edge Computing : MQTT, Raspberry Pi, hardware accelerators.  - Systems Design : scalable Industry 4.0 and satellite applications (frontend, backend, databases).  - Testing : unit (pytest, unittest), system (Robot/Behave) and end-to-end.  - Product & Project Management : Agile/Scrum (JIRA), Product Ownership, Product Management.  - Documentation & Reporting : LaTeX, academic writing.  - Hardware & Prototyping : Arduino, robotics, sensor integration, soldering, 3D design (SolidWorks/Fusion 360) and 3D printing (FDM).  - Operating systems : Windows & Linux.  - Public speaking & training materials (English/Spanish); effective communication.  - English proficiency: C2 EF SET, C1 Cambridge FCE.
content_suggestions.after: - Python (OOP, NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, pytest, FastAPI, CI/CD).  - PyTorch, TensorFlow / Keras.  - Computer Vision: OpenCV, object detection, segmentation, image processing, remote sensing imagery, GIS.  - Data Engineering: ETL pipelines, Apache Airflow.  - Data Visualization: Tableau, PowerBI, Grafana.  - Web/UI Prototyping: Gradio, Streamlit.  - DevOps / Cloud: Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub Actions, AWS, GCP.  - IoT & Edge Computing: MQTT, Raspberry Pi.  - Systems Design: scalable Industry 4.0 and satellite applications.  - Testing: unit, system, and end-to-end.  - Product & Project Management: Agile/Scrum (JIRA), Product Ownership.  - Documentation & Reporting: LaTeX.  - Hardware & Prototyping: Arduino, robotics, sensors, 3D design (SolidWorks/Fusion 360) and 3D printing.  - Languages: English (C2 EF SET, C1 Cambridge FCE), Spanish (Native).

content_suggestions.issue: Datathon win present but could be foregrounded as an accomplishment relevant to data engineering and ML.
content_suggestions.before: - 2024 | Winner of the Datathon Río Cuarto 2024, developing improvements for an LLM chatbot for bullying prevention. Competed in groups of 4 people with approximately 100 participants, performing ETL activities.
content_suggestions.after: - 2024 | Winner, Datathon Río Cuarto 2024: developed improvements for an LLM chatbot for bullying prevention; competed with ~100 participants in teams of 4, performing ETL activities.

achievements_to_add.title: Datathon Río Cuarto 2024 – Winner
achievements_to_add.context: Part of a team of 4, competing among ~100 participants in a data-ETL/AI challenge.
achievements_to_add.impact: Demonstrated practical ML/ETL integration and teamwork under competitive conditions.

achievements_to_add.title: AI division launch at Ascentio Technologies
achievements_to_add.context: Led the initiation of the company’s AI division, transferring expertise to the team and enabling new client opportunities in computer vision and Industry 4.0.
achievements_to_add.impact: Expanded service offerings and client base by applying CV/AI capabilities to industrial contexts.

achievements_to_add.title: End-to-end computer-vision production-control system for industrial plant
achievements_to_add.context: Led design, rollout and maintenance of a CV system integrating multi-object detection/tracking, edge computing, IoT protocols and real-time dashboards.
achievements_to_add.impact: Enabled performance and efficiency monitoring in a live industrial setting.

formatting_suggestions.issue: Contact details and links are present but could be streamlined for ATS and readability.
formatting_suggestions.recommendation: Place name, city, and country on one line; include a single email and a compact LinkedIn URL; remove extraneous links unless necessary for ATS.

formatting_suggestions.issue: No executive summary to anchor CV for the CV Engineer role.
formatting_suggestions.recommendation: Add a two- to three-sentence profile at top focusing on end-to-end CV solutions, production deployment, and cross-functional leadership in manufacturing/industrial contexts.

formatting_suggestions.issue: Bullet phrasing varies; some bullets are long and complex.
formatting_suggestions.recommendation: Standardize bullets to one line each when possible; use parallel structure (verb + scope + result). Keep most bullets to 1–2 lines max.

formatting_suggestions.issue: Education and certifications are interspersed with experience; consider hierarchy.
formatting_suggestions.recommendation: Move Education and Certifications after Skills or after Experience to emphasize professional impact first.

formatting_suggestions.issue: Competitions and publications are scattered across sections.
formatting_suggestions.recommendation: Create a concise 'Achievements & Projects' subsection or consolidate under Competitions and Personal Projects with consistent formatting and dates.
Where possible, quantify outcomes using numbers from the resume (e.g., team size, timeframes, scope, platforms involved) to improve ATS ranking and readability.

formatting_suggestions.issue: Mixed usage of terms (e.g., CV vs Computer Vision; L0; API formats).
formatting_suggestions.recommendation: Use consistent terminology (prefer 'computer vision' and 'CV' after first use; define acronyms on first occurrence).

formatting_suggestions.issue: Use of tables or non-text elements could hinder parsing.
formatting_suggestions.recommendation: Ensure the resume is a single-column text layout with standard bullet icons and ensure no embedded images or tables.
